TopicTitle: [v1.3!] Silisko Industries Doughnut Research & Spacecraft Development

Articles.Content:
This project has been incorporated into NovaPunch! http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=4180.0

Hello! I make parts for SIDR&SD. Originally for personal use, I decided just to put them here since the vanilla game is terribly lacking in parts! (for now)

IMPORTANT NOTE FOR THOSE UPGRADING FROM VERSIONS 1.0 AND LOWER

2 meter parts have been renamed to 1.75 meter. Due to sunday punch naming some of his parts the same as mine, I had to rename my parts internally as well. If you install these parts over installations of the old pack, you will have duplicate copies in your parts list. However, due to the renaming, old ships will not work. As a work around, use the duplicate part method mentioned previously to swap out parts one by one. It\'s not ideal, but it will have to do.

Download 1.3!

Please report any problems you find. Now with satellites!

Download Pod Replacer #1: Gemini/Mercury inspired

Download Pod Replacer #2: Unmanned control module

Pictures and details!

- AA-BB Linear Decoupling Strut

Similar to a normal decoupler, but made of scrap metal and a lot longer.

- SSH Series, Model 221 Solid Booster

After draining the water out, these big meaty boosters should work fine. More or less.

- HH-77 Insulated Fuel Tank

An orange tank from the HH-77 line of budget spacecraft parts.

- HH-77 Insulated Nosecone

An orange nosecone from the HH-77 line of budget spacecraft parts.

Also available with an attached parachute.

- Small Bootleg Command Module

Constructed of the highest quality scrap metal, glass bottles and used paper mache.

- GG-M4 Liquid Fuel Engine

Less engine, less safety. Burns through fuel at 1.5x speed, but has the same thrust and 1/3rd the weight of the LV-T30.

- TD-M9 Mini Decoupler

A much smaller version of a normal decoupler, weighing much less and being cheaper, at the expense of being fairly sensitive.

- CMM-96 Surplus Booster

Don\'t let it\'s legal status fool you, this is a wonderful booster. The only problem with it is it can only be mounted on the sides of things.

- HH-78a Large Fuel Tank

A large 2 meter tank from the HH-78 set of rocket parts.

- HH-78b Adapter

A large 2 meter to 1 meter adapter from the HH-78 set of rocket parts.

- HH-78c Adapter

A large 2 meter to 3 meter adapter from the HH-78 set of rocket parts.

- MPM-20 S.A.S Module

A larger SAS for larger rockets. Quite powerful and heavy.

- Medium Bertha

One of the most powerful engines on the market. It loves to overheat, eat fuel, and take long walks on the beach.

- AM-27 Nosecone

A fancy roundy nose cone! Very prestigious.

- KMX Industries MiniBooster

Usually in Kerbal constructions, parts are UPSIZED after having been found to be TOO SMALL. Not at KMX Industries. Instead, we make things SMALLER after complaints about them being TOO SMALL!

- Platinum Communications Model BXs-7

A small communications satellite, (hopefully) destined for Kerbin orbit.

- Platinum Communications Model BXs-9

A lightweight communications relay satellite built by Platinum Communications Ltd.

- And a hell of a lot more


  • [li]Large Bertha[/li]
    [li]Twin Bertha Lite[/li]
    [li]Double-length 2M fuel tank[/li]
    [li]Strake[/li]
    [li]2 meter decoupler[/li]
    [li]2 to 3 meter[/li]
    [li]3 to 2 meter[/li]
    [li]1 to 2 meter[/li]
    [li]2 to 1 meter[/li]
    [li]2 to 3 meter decoupler[/li]
    [li]1 to 2 meter decoupler[/li]
    [li]2 to 1 meter decoupler[/li]
    [li]Too much more[/li]

Changelog!

v1.3:

Tweaked N1 engine, made it less likely to detach at random

Tweaked all 1.75m engines, now are heavier but produce a bit more thrust

Added small orbital adjustment engine

Added small hollow decoupler

Added 1m to 1.75 short adapter

Reduced decouple force on clamp and decoupler strut

Updated skins of the large SRB and the sidemount SRB

Made the Nano SAS have larger effects

v1.2:

Fixed a small texture bug with the long fuel tank alt skin

Added payload assist module

Added space probe

Added radial flange

Added decoupler flange

Added docking claw (decorative for now)

Tweaked N1 stats a bit

Removed an errant .psd from the download

v1.1:

Added a selection of N1 rocket inspired parts

Added an unmanned payload guidance module

Added alt paint job for double length tank

Renamed all 2 meter parts to 1.75 meter

Fixed strake having no information

Added Nano SAS

Added Nano Decoupler

Added 1.75 to 2 meter adapters

Updated stack parachute texture

New model for Bootleg Command Module

Due to release demands, I didn\'t fit the Payload Assist Module into this update

v1.0:

Improved numerous textures and models

Changed the stats for the GG-M4

Added two new two-meter engines

Added a two-meter double length fuel tank

Balanced out the large SRB

Added a tiny nosecone for the mini SRBs

Added two-meter decoupler clamps

Added two sizes of detachable nosecone

Added parachute with an attachment point (to place nosecones on)

Added strake (like a tall winglet)

Decoupler strut no longer allows fuel flow

Changed Medium Bertha to be a midpoint between the two new engines

Size adapters now contain 100 units of fuel.

v0.9:

Made 2m SAS not be completely useless

Orange insulated fuel tank now made very resistant to heat.

Minidecoupler now has less force, for non-disruptive in-orbit disconnections

Balanced out the GG-M4 engine

Updated a bunch of textures

Added Mini solid booster

Added 2 meter straight decoupler

v0.81:

Tweaked 2m fuel tank amounts and weights to better fit between 1m and 3m fuel tanks from Sunday Punch\'s pack.

v0.8:

Added 2 meter detachable nosecone (currently fairly useless, will be better with KSP 0.9)

Added 2 satellite payloads to take to orbit (eventually will be compatible with the above nosecone)

Updated all nosecones to have almost 0 drag

v0.7:

2 meter SAS strength increased slightly

Tapered 2 meter SAS model so it can be stacked without z-fighting

Added half-height 2m fuel tank

Decreased weight of both 2 meter fuel tanks

v0.6:

I hate the number six so I\'m skipping this version

v0.5:

Tweaked CMM booster, now costs less(like that matters...yet)

Changed the GG-M4 engine to use 3x the normal liquid engine fuel, but have more thrust, and be very heat efficient

Various 2 meter parts no longer corrupt saved ships

Added a ton of new 2 meter couplings

v0.4:

Reduced 2 meter tank fuel capacity by 100 (was 800, now 700)

Changed 2 meter engine texture (again)

Fixed typo in miniliquidengine ('shame' was supposed to be 'same')

Added 2 to 3 meter coupler

Added 2 meter nosecone

Added 1 meter nosecone

Added Mini Decoupler

v0.31:

Changed 2 meter engine texture

v0.3:

Added various 2 meter wide segments(2-1m adapter, 2m engine, 2m SAS module and 2m fuel tank)

Added Energia-inspired rocket booster. Cannot be stacked.

v0.2:

Removed hollow decoupler as it was unfinished

Parts can now be placed on external fuel tanks

Decoupler strut now weighs slightly more

Added more detail to the SRB and Bootleg Capsule textures

v0.1:

Initial release

Awesome, i love the new Decoupler. Was it your intention to let fuel pass it ?

Moreover you cant put decoupler on the new orange fueltank. Would it be possible to fix that ?
Love those decouplers.

Moreover you cant put decoupler on the new orange fueltank. Would it be possible to fix that ?

I'll change that ASAP. Originally it was intended but I can switch it easily.

I'll change that ASAP. Originally it was intended but I can switch it easily.

Yes please fix it. We can't add Heat Sinks and the Like onto them either. Keep Burning out Engines while hauling Retarded amounts of Fuel.
Updated to 0.2. Download in first post, as always.

Working on an Energia inspired solid rocket booster:

High fuel capacity and thrust, cannot be stacked.

Working on an Energia inspired solid rocket booster:

High fuel capacity and thrust, cannot be stacked.

although energia had of course liquid boosters, but allright, I like the design so I'll let this sacrilege slip!

Well we'll just pretend they're full of liquid fuel.

Anyway, finished the booster:

Started work on some 1.75 (or something) meter segments:

But I am going to go to bed, and will resume work tomorrow.

Nice work.

Its good to see more people developing mods for the game
I can't believe how fast you did all this. GREAT WORK!

Great parts man especially the Command Module but I have noticed one thing.

The HH-77 fuel tank seems to share fuel between tanks on the same stage. For instance if you build a rocket with 3 stock tanks & 1 stock LFR and then booster strap 2 HH-77's to it both with standard LFR's the fuel will drain from the first 2 stock tanks on the central booster before the HH-77 tanks start to be emptied. However the fuel will only move in 1 direction from the stock tanks in the centre outwards into the HH-77's and not back into the central booster. This has the effect of depleting the central boosters fuel before the strap on boosters and means you have to carry dead tanks for 1/4 of the first stage. You can get around it partial by doing an ATLAS and dropping engine but your still hauling a lot of dead weight. Is this the way the tanks are meantto work ?

Great parts man especially the Command Module but I have noticed one thing.

The HH-77 fuel tank seems to share fuel between tanks on the same stage. For instance if you build a rocket with 3 stock tanks & 1 stock LFR and then booster strap 2 HH-77's to it both with standard LFR's the fuel will drain from the first 2 stock tanks on the central booster before the HH-77 tanks start to be emptied. However the fuel will only move in 1 direction from the stock tanks in the centre outwards into the HH-77's and not back into the central booster. This has the effect of depleting the central boosters fuel before the strap on boosters and means you have to carry dead tanks for 1/4 of the first stage. You can get around it partial by doing an ATLAS and dropping engine but your still hauling a lot of dead weight. Is this the way the tanks are meantto work ?

At the moment, it's how the game is actually coded to use fuel, he's thinking of a fix I believe.

Can you add a new decoupler like your current one but that does not let fuel flow through it?

Thank you for these cool parts!

Amazing work, great to see people and the love for this game!

keep it up my friend.

It's funny considering I've only had the game since the 21st...

I'll change the linear decoupler to disallow fuel flow (if possible)
Can we have 2 Versions of it? I like Having the Fuel Go thru them.

It's funny considering I've only had the game since the 21st...

I'll change the linear decoupler to disallow fuel flow (if possible)

Thanks man.
Yeah, keep both versions in. They can both be useful.
0.3 (probably) coming soon!

Updated with 0.3!

Couldn't figure out how to disallow fuel flow, so the alt version of the decoupler will come when I figure out how
Hey im having trouble adding these parts cause of the rar thing, i always put it in the parts folder but it doesnt show and i have always added the other parts successfully

Oh, man, these are awesome. I started putting some parts together, stepped back, and realized it was an S-IVB. Now all we need is a 2m to 1m adapter, and then 2m to 3m adapters to go with Sunday Punch's parts. And if we can start turning those adapters into decoupler shrouds...

Can anyone say 'first KSP all-up Saturn V'?

Just realized I forgot to put info for the new engine in the thread. I'll add it soon.

Also, some planned pieces:

Apollo inspired command module lower half (functions like a controllable solid rocket booster)

Micro decoupler

2m hollow decoupler

Alternate 2m engines

2m nosecone

And when the features are supported:

Heat shields

Deployable solar panels and radiators

More command modules
I've been experimenting with different engines and tanks. I put a stock LFR under your 2m tank with a CC and 1m-2m shroud and that sucker went to 38km and burned for 2:20 on about 75% power.
